info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 9 at 8:28PM EST until November 11 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches by Tuesday morning. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.
* WHERE...In Maryland, Western Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties.
* WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to midnight EST Monday Night.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain to change to snow by around or shortly after midnight. Snow showers will continue on and off through Monday and Monday night, before gradually winding down Tuesday morning. While snow showers will be possible over that prolonged period, locally heavy bursts of snow may be possible later Monday afternoon and Monday evening, with the greatest impacts expected during that time.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST MONDAY NIGHT

area.areaDesc: Western Garrett; Western Grant; Western Pendleton
